Daily Discussion 170/793

embeds.title: Victorious Crown
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Champ / Downfall

Replaces Champion's Crown.
Start each combat in **Ultimate** **Stance**, which lasts for 1 turn.
*Conglaturation!! You are the greatest winner.*

messages.content: Doesn’t feel that good
Ultimate Stance got nerfed by the change to <technical jig>

embeds.title: Technical Jig
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Whenever you enter a **Stance**, gain 3 (4) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: So you can no longer get bonkers vigor/counter out of just using stance enters in ultimate stance
If you compare it against something like <guardian gear boss relic>

embeds.title: Guardian Gear
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

Replaces Bronze Gear.
Begin each combat in **Defensive Mode,** which persists for 3 turns.
*Replace every 3,000 floors.*

messages.content: the difference is extremely stark
guardian gear pretty much solves defensive issues for the first 3 turns
while ultimate stance, especially because of champ’s draw issues, doesn’t really guarantee you very much
since you need finishers or skill bonus proccing cards to really use it
I think it should be buffed to two turns
two turns would definitely feel better and maybe comparable to other starter relic upgrades
Yeah ultimate stance was busted, but technical jig and draw nerfs means you often won't have the resources to take advantage of it
I'd buff it to 2 turns or make it a token like <gear up> that just enters ultimate for 0 cost
didn't it get nerfed at some point?
this relic just feels bad, as you end up in turn 2 without being in a stance

as there arent a lot of cards that enter stances, and there are an exceeding amount of cards that rely on stances to be played/good, trading your consistency for a frontload turn 1 is less good than it sounds
used to be 2 turns
I think it may be fine as 2, but I'd rather see it as a token
I think it would be fine as a token that doesn't replace your starter relic maybe?
So a boss relic that just gives you a "enter ultimate stance" card on combat start
A relic that gives a 1 cost rare would honestly be kinda mid considering <tiny bowler hat> gives a 3 cost and is considered alright

embeds.title: Tiny Bowler Hat
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of combat, add a Study the Spire card to your hand. It costs 0.
*Whosoever controls the hat, controls the Spire.*

messages.content: probably would be a bit busted tbh
Honestly not really, champ has so little draw to take advantage of ultimate anymore
theres a reason why <ultimate stance card> activates on the next turn

embeds.title: Ultimate Stance
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 (0) :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

During your next turn, you are in **Ultimate** **Stance**.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: <gut punch>

embeds.title: Gut Punch
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 8 (12) damage.
Any **Stance** **Combo:** Enter **Ultimate** **Stance** for 1 turn.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: hmmm
which costs 1 and requires a stance
so its not unconditional
I think it would be worse if it was same turn, you already used one of your 4 cards to draw into it so you'll have less draw to actually use it
Didn't it used to put you in there for like 3 turns or some absolutely insane number like that?
Moment of Truth
if Moment of Truth ever got changed, then it would be fine
but a draw positive scaling/blocking cantrip with retain is about as broken as it sounds

https://discord.com/channels/669242017427226638/789999233208942613/951466728817307748

Yes but I think ultimate stance was something different back then
That is a moment of truth problem, not an ultimate stance problem. Ultimate stance is mainly strong from moment of truth, refreshments, and <precise thrust>

embeds.title: Precise Thrust
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 6 (8) damage.
Berserker **Combo:** Deal 6 (8) damage.
Defensive **Combo:** Gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: <precise thrust champ>

embeds.title: Precise Thrust
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 6 (8) damage.
Berserker **Combo:** Deal 6 (8) damage.
Defensive **Combo:** Gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: thank you
i agree, but i would prefer mommy to be changed before anything else
I could even see Ultimate Stance the card being changed to the current turn
Yeah I think of moment of truth was changed it may be fine, but I'd still consider <refreshments> to be a problem

embeds.title: Refreshment
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

*Berserker **Combo:** Gain :e_champ: :e_champ:  ( :e_champ:) , then **Exhaust** this.
Defensive **Combo:** Draw 3 (4) cards.

messages.content: tbh, its just an Adrenaline++
not massive, just really good

I think boss swap on champ is way to good already so i've used this boss relic upgrade like twice. Already your starter relic isnt very strong; with your base deck alone you have a very good shot of starting the fight with one of your stance cards and all champ runs are looking to draft more of those anyways. Meanwhile nearly every boss relic you can swap to is good. Champ has the most flexibility in boss relic options mostly thanks to his raw power; even getting a bad hit like busted crown or tiny house wont lose you the run like it might on a character like silent.
I don't think theres much wrong with victorious crown, I just think that champion's crown is a bad relic and so I don't get to take it.
Honestly please don't, it would just be worse gut punch, and would be too similar also
maybe on upgrade, so you have the choice yk
also taking away a setup move from champ to give more "ooga booga I hit you hard now" kinda sucks.
Champ has like... what... 2 setup cards? Ultimate stance and headbutt.
Rope a Dope
aka the best one
Champ already has the issue of feeling too simple, so removing setup cards in favor of adding more immediate benefit cards is bad
well, champ in general needs a big rework IMO
Yeah I think nerfing some of the extremely overtuned for no good reason cards, honestly maybe defensive stance finisher nerf again but more incentive to use finishers
and add more draw
Honestly current mommy of truth could be nerfed to 1 cost and be fine
I was thinking of something more....drastic
like just completely butchering the character and restarting
I'd rather just see that time and effort allocated to a new character
Well i like the champ aesthetic and style, i just wish he felt more fun
at the moment he just feels like scuffed watcher with no deck manipulation
Nemesis when?? :awaken:
One really weird thing about champ is that he only has 2 draw positive cards (3 if you count rope a dope) yet they are both EXTREMELY good
And I think even if champ had good draw they would both be very good

This feels exceedingly weak for a starter relic to boss relic upgrade. I like the idea well enough, but it should probably give you at least 2 turns in ultimate stance (It's pretty rough starting turn 2 in no stance at all for several of champs cards). I have a difficult time imagining what you would take this over right now, as it seems worse than just about everything other than broken crown and sacred bark. 

Champ is in a weird state right now anyways, and his best playstyle does involve heavy burst damage in the early turns. I think it's probably more important to lower some burst numbers and increase champs options for scaling than to focus too much on fixing a relic like this. I will say that you aren't losing much if this switches out with your starter relic, which is pretty underwhelming
If champ didnt play so unga bunga otk, having draw wouldnt be an issue
its an inherent flaw with how Vigor and Counter work
Moment of truth is probably his best card, and refreshments is your choice of skim or seeing red (or both)
they mechanically function in a way that supports big one-offs rather than slow burn setup plaus
I think counter doesn't, but vigor most certainly does
waiting for more counter support to make it a viable archetype 😔
i mean, it works very similarly at a base level to Goop
well, actually its closer to soulburn
nevermind
Not really, since you have literally no way of controlling when it activates (except for if you somehow get strike for strike)
I just think of it like randomly targeted damage. Someone will hit it and take damage from it eventually,
counter is wonky like that
it relies on taking hits, which you kinda dont want to do
if it didnt have somewhat high numbers it would be considered worse than any other damaging debuff
just for the fact that you *have* to take a hit
I mean, if champ had adequate block it would be fine
if champ had *any sort of block engine* it would be fine
champ has big block when he wants to
but its incredibly inconsistent and frontloaded
<iron fortress> is such a good card if champ had like any draw to access multiple block cards in 1 turn

embeds.title: Iron Fortress
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 2 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.
At the end of each turn, gain 3 (5) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: play a footwork and 2 metallicize
Iron Fortress is great, too bad it doesnt get much value on Champ
I think it would be a top card on almost every other character
Prismatic Barrier :awaken:
hey now, dont be dissin the bark yo
HEHE ULTIMATE STANCE GO BRRRRRRR

Just because it got off topic, just gonna reiterate my points for those of who that are just joining us. The relic is pretty bad since you usually don't have the setup to take advantage of it on turn 1, and it leaves you out of a stance for turn 2.

Some suggested changes people mentioned would to revert it back to giving you 2 turns of ultimate, but I'd prefer to see it just give a token to enter ultimate, similar to gear up. It also wouldn't replace the starting relic in this situation.
